title: Modeling a Non-Periodic Context-Logarithmic Function, Part A

content.question: Part A (i) ​​Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants <math alttext="a"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math alttext="b"> <mi>b</mi> </math> in the expression for <math alttext="G open parentheses t close parentheses"> <mi>G</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </math>. (ii) Find the values for <math alttext="a"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math alttext="b"> <mi>b</mi> </math> as a decimal approximation.

topic.text: 2.14: Logarithmic Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
